text.text_translated:
Some news makes us think the world is a bad place with a lot of war. But there is some good news too.
From 1945 to 1990, there were 30 big wars. These wars killed more than 100,000 people each. Today, there are still wars inside some countries. But countries now live together more peacefully.
But there are more attacks on normal people now. These attacks are to make people afraid. And wars kill many normal people. They kill more normal people than soldiers.
But the numbers for normal people are not all bad. More people die from crime than from political problems. The number of deaths from crime is nine times bigger. But the number of murders in the world went down. In the year 2000, 8 people in 100,000 were killed. In 2015, about 5.3 people in 100,000 were killed.

feedback.feedback: FAIL: Vocabulary Violation. The text fails the deep qualitative audit due to the inclusion of vocabulary above the A2 level. Deviation: Use of B1 vocabulary. The word 'political' is not on the A2 word list. It appears in the sentence: 'More people die from crime than from political problems.' Suggestion: Replace 'political problems'. Use a simpler A2 phrase. Examples: 'problems with the government' or 'problems between groups of people'.

But the numbers for normal people are not all bad. More people die from crime than from political problems. The number of deaths from crime is nine times bigger. But the number of murders in the world went down. In the year 2000, 8 people in 100,000 were killed. In 2015, about 5.3 people in 100,000 were killed.
